–ú–∞–≥–∞–ª—å—è–Ω–µ—Å123456...8>> –Ü–Ω—à—ñ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏ Establishing Modern Master-level Studies in Information Systems 561592-EPP-1-2015-1- FR-EPPKA2-CBHE-JP Project acronym: ¬´MASTIS¬ª National Structural Measures Project Priority ‚Äì Higher Education and Society Project duration: 15 October 2015 ‚Äì 14 October 2018 EU funding instrument: (to be completed by NEO) Program European Neighbourhood Instrument Erasmus+ (CBHE) grant amount: 767 509,00 ‚Ç¨ Target group : students, PhD, LLL. Grant holder: UNIVERSITE LUMIERE LYON 2 Coordinator and General Manager: Prof. Dr. LOP Emmanuelle, Head of the Department of International relations office Contacts: tel: +33 4 78 69 72 98 ; fax: + 33 4 72 71 98 44 e-mail: emmanuelle.lop@univ-lyon2.fr Partnership: ¬ß Universite Lumiere Lyon 2, France ¬ß Guido Carli Free International University for Social Studies, Italy ¬ß University of M√ºnster, Germany ¬ß Kaunas University of Technology, Lithuania ¬ß University of Maribor, Slovenia ¬ß University of Agder, Norway ¬ß Lulea University of Technology, Sweden ¬ß University of Liechtenstein, Liechtenstein ¬ß Italian Association for Informatics and Automatic Calculation, Italy ¬ß Simon Kuznets Kharkiv National University of Economics, Ukraine ¬ß National Technical University of Ukraine ‚ÄúKPI‚Äù, Ukraine ¬ß Lviv Polytechnic National University, Ukraine ¬ß Vinnytsia National Technical University, Ukraine ¬ß Kherson State University, Ukraine ¬ß National Technical University ‚ÄúKharkiv Polytechnic Institute‚Äù, Ukraine ¬ß Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine ¬ß University of Donja Gorica , Montenegro ¬ß University ‚ÄúMediterranean‚Äù Podgorica, Montenegro Project goals and objectives: Wider objective is to improve Master Programme in Information Systems according to the needs of the modern society; to bring the universities closer to changes in global labour market and world education sphere; to enable them to stay responsive to employers‚Äô needs; to give students an idea of various job profiles in the Information Systems domain; to ensure employability throughout graduates‚Äô professional and soft skills. Specific project objectives are: ¬ß improvement of Master Programme in Information Systems according to the requirements of business; ¬ß modernization of the current Degree Profile and curricula in Information Systems. Degree Profile and Curricula revision will be implemented in accordance with the newest standards of Higher education and the compatibility with the National qualification frameworks; ¬ß development of innovative academic environment for Master program of Informational Systems as a platform for training/retraining, PhD, LLL; ¬ß provision/modernization of labs infrastructure for Information Systems. Activities: ¬ß Analysis stakeholders requirements to Master Programme in Information Systems and revision of current Degree Profile and curricula in Information Systems; ¬ß Development new competence- and experience-oriented curricula including ECTS based on Tuning methodology Curriculum; ¬ß Creation innovative academic environment for Information Systems Programme as a platform for training/retraining, PhD, LLL for providing Master Programme in Information Systems Capacity Building ¬ß Dissemination and exploitation project results. ¬ß Assurance the quality of project implementation and achievement of the planned results Expected results: I. Improved of Master Programme in Information Systems according to the needs of the global labor market. II. Revised the current Degree Profile and curricula in Information Systems according to the Bologna recommendations for concerning the allocation of transferable credits, the learning outcomes and the compatibility with the National qualification framework. III. Developed, implemented and accredited new competence- and experience-oriented curricula including ECTS based on Tuning methodology. IV. Created innovative academic environment for Information Systems Programme as a platform for training/retraining, PhD, LLL and modernized labs infrastructure for Information Systems. V. Disseminated project results. VI. Developed reports on project results. Main goals of the centre: ‚Äì Exchange of experience in the sphere of data and documents procession. ‚Äì Performing scientific research and projects with software products and technologies Accantum GMBH. ‚Äì Introduction to software products and implementation technologies in student computer workshops. ‚Äì Include software technologies in the education work programs. scientific research Implementation of research works carried out under the guidance of professor, D.Sc Tomashevsky Valentin. The responsible person for communication with Accantum GMBH appointed to senior lecturer CAMDPS Oliinyk Yurii.

–ö–∞—Ñ–µ–¥—Ä–∞ —ñ–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º –•–ù–ï–£ —ñ–º. –°. –ö—É–∑–Ω–µ—Ü—è —î –∫–æ–æ—Ä–¥–∏–Ω–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –º—ñ–∂–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ–≥–æ ERASMUS+ MASTIS ¬´–°—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—è —Å—É—á–∞—Å–Ω–æ—ó –º–∞–≥—ñ—Å—Ç–µ—Ä—Å—å–∫–æ—ó –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–∏ –≤ –≥–∞–ª—É–∑—ñ —ñ–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º¬ª, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–∂ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—î –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—É —É –¥–æ—Å–ª—ñ–¥–Ω–∏—Ü—å–∫—ñ–π –º–µ—Ä–µ–∂—ñ ERCIS(The European Research Center for Information Systems https://www.ercis.org). ERCIS ‚Äì —Ü–µ –ø–æ—Ç—É–∂–Ω–∞–º—ñ–∂–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω–∞ –º–µ—Ä–µ–∂–∞ –Ω–∞—É–∫–æ–≤–æ-–¥–æ—Å–ª—ñ–¥–Ω–∏—Ö—É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤, –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ñ–æ—Å–æ–±–∏—Å—Ç—ñ —á–ª–µ–Ω–∏ —Ç–∞ —á–ª–µ–Ω–∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—ó —Ä–∞–¥–∏, —â–æ–ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é—Ç—å —É —Å—Ñ–µ—Ä—ñ—ñ–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º.
–ó–∞–≤–¥—è–∫–∏ –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ñ–π —É—á–∞—Å—Ç—ñ –≤ –æ—Å–≤—ñ—Ç–Ω—ñ—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞—Ö –≤ –≥–∞–ª—É–∑—ñ –Ü–¢, —è–∫—ñ—Å–Ω—ñ–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—ñ–π–Ω—ñ–π –ø—ñ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—Ü—ñ —Å—Ç—É–¥–µ–Ω—Ç—ñ–≤ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫—ñ —É–Ω—ñ–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—Ç–µ—Ç–∏ –≤–ø–µ—Ä—à–µ —É–≤—ñ–π—à–ª–∏–¥–æ —Ü—å–æ–≥–æ –≥–ª–æ–±–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–≥–ª—è–¥—É.–í—ñ—Ç—ñ—î–º–æ —É—á–∞—Å–Ω–∏–∫—ñ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç—É ERASMUS+ MASTIS, —è–∫—ñ —É—Å–ø—ñ—à–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é—Ç—å —É —Ä–æ–∑–±—É–¥–æ–≤—ñ –Ü–¢-–æ—Å–≤—ñ—Ç–∏ —Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω—ñ —É –∑–≤—ñ—Ç—ñ.

International Student Research Competition in Artificial Intelligence 2025
The purpose of the competition is to intensify the research efforts of students, stimulate interest in science and technology among young people, as well as to help solve problems and tackle practical tasks in the area of artificial intelligence.
Students (trainees) who are pursuing higher education at the bachelor‚Äôs and master‚Äôs degree level (referred to as students) in higher education institutions of Ukraine, regardless of ownership and subordination, including foreigners and stateless persons studying in these educational institutions, students of higher education institutions of other countries, may participate in the Competition.
The Organizing Committee oversees the organization, conduct, and compliance with the Competition requirements.
The institution of Higher Education where the second round of the Competition will take place (the base institution of higher education) is the National Technical University of Ukraine ‚ÄúIgor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute‚Äù.

We are pleased to announce the call for papers for the upcoming ‚ÄúMathematical Modeling and Simulation of Systems‚Äù International conference, which will take place on November, 10-12, 2025 in Chernihiv Polytechnic National University, Chernihiv, Ukraine. Authors are invited to submit original unpublished manuscripts that demonstrate recent advances at the following areas of interest: Methods of mathematical modeling and simulation Tools for mathematical modeling and simulation Mathematical modeling and simulation of systems in ecology, manufacturing, information technology, project management Mathematical modeling and simulation of cyber physical systems All submitted papers will undergo peer review. Accepted and presented papers will be published in ‚ÄúLecture Notes in Networks and Systems‚Äù (Electronic ISSN 2367-3389, Print ISSN 2367-3370). The materials of LNNS series are indexed by SCOPUS, EI Compendex, INSPEC, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, SCImago, and also submitted for consideration to the Web of Science. The paper‚Äôs language is USA English only and format is according to the Springer templates (Microsoft Word or LaTeX). Detailed information about formatting you may find on Information for Authors of Springer Proceedings. Accepted papers must be presented on Oral session. IMPORTANT DATES Paper submission due: September 1, 2025 Notification of paper acceptance: October 20, 2025 Registration and full payment due: November 7, 2025 Conference date: November 10-12, 2025 Paper submission via CMT submission form Report`s abstracts (thesis) sending till November 7, 2025 to mods.ipmms@gmail.com More details on Conference‚Äôs site mods.stu.cn.ua We hope this information may be interesting to your colleagues.

content:
International Programming Proggy-Buggy Towel Contest ‚Äì 2024
Mark your calendars for May 25, 2024, and don‚Äôt forget to take a towel! We invite you to participate in the annual informal International Programming Proggy-Buggy Towel Contest.
Why a towel? The concept of a Proggy-Buggy Contest is derived from Douglas Adams‚Äôs book The Hitchhiker‚Äôs Guide to the Galaxy. As you know, we are fans of this novel (42 minutes, towels, traveling, etc.). Spring Contest is called the Towel Contest and is held on Towel Day. It is celebrated worldwide every year on May 25th as a tribute to the author Douglas Adams by his fans. The towel is the most helpful item for an interstellar traveler and helps in any problematic situation. It has become a tradition for participants to come to the May competitions with towels.
We invite students, developers, testers, and all people who understand how programs are written, know what ‚Äúconsole applications‚Äù and ‚Äústandard input/output streams‚Äù are, and like to solve unsolved problems.
Contest rules:
Only solo participants
‚Äî Three categories of participants: Amateurs, Professionals, and Superheroes (description of categories is available on www.proggy-buggy.com)
‚Äî Participants must solve 13 algorithmic problems in 42 minutes.
‚Äî You may write code in any programming language listed in the Programming Languages and Compilers section.
‚Äî During the contest, all communications must be in English to ensure everyone understands each other.
‚Äî Participants are only allowed to use information published before the start of the contest.
‚Äî Participants are not allowed to use support from coaches or third-party participants
‚Äî The problems will be officially available on May 25th. The contest will begin after the final countdown on the YouTube stream.
‚Äî Three categories of participants: Amateurs, Professionals, and Superheroes (description of categories is available on www.proggy-buggy.com)
‚Äî Participants must solve 13 algorithmic problems in 42 minutes.
‚Äî You may write code in any programming language listed in the Programming Languages and Compilers section.
‚Äî During the contest, all communications must be in English to ensure everyone understands each other.
‚Äî Participants are only allowed to use information published before the start of the contest.
‚Äî Participants are not allowed to use support from coaches or third-party participants
‚Äî The problems will be officially available on May 25th. The contest will begin after the final countdown on the YouTube stream.
Participants residing in the territory of the Russian Federation, as well as in other sanctioned territories, are not allowed to take part in the Proggy-Buggy Contest.
The Contest is held online, but you can join from one of our DataArt offices worldwide. The list of locations will be published on the registration page about a month before the event.
Participation is free, but don‚Äôt forget to register: https://proggy-buggy.com/register.
For more information, visit our site (https://proggy-buggy.com/), join us on Telegram (https://t.me/proggybuggy), or contact us. And Don‚Äôt Panic!!!

content:
International Programming Proggy-Buggy Contest 2024
The Ultimate Question and the Contest Inspiration
The concept of a 42-minute time limit is derived from ‚ÄúThe Hitchhiker‚Äôs Guide to the Galaxy,‚Äù a book by Douglas Adams. In the story, a unique computer named Deep Thought is programmed to answer the ‚ÄúUltimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything‚Äù and provide the key to solving all the problems in the universe. After seven million years of continuous calculations, the computer finally revealed the answer: ‚Äú42.‚Äù
Another concept inspired by the book is the name of our Spring competition. It‚Äôs called the Towel Contest and is held on Towel Day, celebrated worldwide every year on May 25th as a tribute to the author Douglas Adams by his fans.
It has become a tradition for participants to come to the May competitions with towels. A towel is the most helpful thing an interstellar hitchhiker can have because, as Douglas Adams writes, ‚ÄúAny man who can hitch the length and breadth of the Galaxy, rough it, slum it, struggle against terrible odds, win through and still know where his towel is, is clearly a man to be reckoned with.‚Äù
Place and Time
The contest is held twice a year ‚Äì Towel Day on May 25th and the Proggy-Buggy Contest on October 26th, 2024.
Registration is required to participate in the competition. One day before the contest, all registered participants will receive two links: one to the contest page, which will become active at the start of the competition, and another to the live stream, where the official start of the competition will be announced.
You can practice solving problems on the Training page. You can use your previous registration or create a new account to access it. To do so, follow the link to one of last year‚Äôs contests.
On October 26, 2024, join us online from anywhere in the world (except the Russian Federation, as well as other sanctioned territories), or in-person at one of our DataArt R&D Centers or Partner Hubs:
Kyiv, Solomyanska str. 7 (State University of Information and Communication Technologies, State University of Information and Communication Technologies);
‚Äî Kyiv, Politekhnichna St, 41, Academic building ‚Ññ18(Faculty of Informatics and Computer Engineering, Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute).

metadata.title: Science ‚Äì Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering

content:
Scientific Schools
There are several scientific schools, headed by leading specialists of the Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering (IPI)
Development of exact algorithms for intractable combinatorial problems
Scientific school ‚ÄúDevelopment of exact algorithms for intractable combinatorial problems‚Äù is led by combinatorial optimization laboratory staff (scientific director is Professor, Doctor of Engineering Sciences Pavlov Oleksandr). As part of this school, the scientific school ‚ÄúCombinatorial optimization of intelligent information technology design‚Äù was founded at the National Technical University of Ukraine ‚ÄúKyiv Polytechnic Institute‚Äù in 1969.
This scientific school published a monograph titled ‚ÄúDecision making in network systems with limited resources‚Äù
Simulation modeling of complex systems and adaptive systems of distance learning
Scientific school ‚ÄúSimulation modeling of complex systems and adaptive systems of distance learning‚Äù is headed by Doctor of Engineering Sciences, Professor, Laureate of the State Prize of Ukraine on Science and Technology Tomashevsky V.M. Simulation models of computing systems, data transfer and processing systems, medical departments management, industrial and organizational management systems were developed.
The obtained scientific results meet international standards and were reported at the 15th European Simulation Multi-conference ESM‚Äô2001 in Prague in 2001 ‚Äì Automatic generating of GPSS/PC programs for queuing network and the 9th International Multi-Conference Advanced Computer Systems, 2002, Miedzyzdroje, Poland ‚Äì The generator of simulation models for distributed virtual transportation networks of delivery. Simulation programs generator built into the interactive system of simulation modeling ISS 2000 was developed for the first time. ISS 2000 system is designed for modeling of queuing and transport networks, has copyright certificate and was demonstrated at the CeBIT-2006 exhibition in Hannover, Germany.
A scientific school for visual modeling of road traffic and macroeconomic indicators forecasting using simulation modeling was also created.
Models and methods of multiprocessor information technologies in dynamic complex systems
Associate professor of CAMDPS department Finogenov Oleksiy
Linguistic modeling for intelligent software systems development
Associate Professor of CAMDPS department Baklan Igor.
Development and implementation of intellectual data analysis methods based on distributed information systems and technologies NVIDIA CUDA
Doctor of Engineering Sciences, Professor Tomashevskyy Valentyn, Senior Lecturer Oliinyk Yuri

metadata.title: Scientific Schools ‚Äì Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering

content:
Employment of Graduates
Where are the graduates working?
Graduates of department ISE are wide profile specialists. Objects of their specialization are in various fields of human activity ‚Äì in the spheres of science, industry, medicine, transport, communication, defense, trade, environmental protection, finance, etc. Our graduates are able to solve a variety of problems: from automation of accounting to development of computer networks and decision-making systems. As system analysts, they deeply understand the essence of complex processes of interaction between different spheres of production, humanities and business, which gives them the advantages for successful competition at the labor market.
Our specialists work wherever software and various information (systems) technology are developed or operated. At first, they are developing (application programmer or programmer-analyst) or exploit (system administrator) software, and then develop system technology (system integrator and task manager of automated workplaces for database accounting). Subsequently, many of them hold senior positions in firms. The latter is significantly promoted by the expanded strategic system thinking and the second economic diploma.
Our graduates have no employment problems. Due to comprehensive knowledge in the fields of computer science, they are irreplaceable both in large companies and in small firms. Graduates work in state institutions, research institutes, banks, commercial structures, industrial enterprises, in particular, in the National Bank of Ukraine, PrivatBank, State Fiscal Service of Ukraine, Security Service of Ukraine, Ministry of Finance of Ukraine, UkrTelecom, in firms Reebok-Ukraine, Motorola Ltd, ‚ÄúNetCracker‚Äù Ltd., Terrasoft Ltd., ‚ÄúUNITY-BARS‚Äù Ltd., ‚ÄúAgromat‚Äù Ltd., Target Plus‚Äù Ltd., ‚ÄúMiranda‚Äù Ltd., ‚ÄúSamsung Electronics‚Äù Ltd., etc.
Many graduates of the department successfully work abroad, in particular in USA, England, Denmark, Mexico, Italy, Canada, Israel, Australia, Germany.
Projects in which the students of department ISE took part:
- Support system for national plan of documents inspections of State Fiscal Service of Ukraine.
2. AIS system for compilation and management of the state budget.
4. Automated passenger management system. Ukrzaliznytsia is the customer -.
5. System of informational support of the KRU in the Ministry of Finance of Ukraine.
6. Information technology system for the National Bank of Ukraine.
Employment of graduates
Spheres of activity of graduates
Graduates of the department ISE are specialists of a wide profile; the tasks that they solve are very diverse; the objects of their research are in various fields of human activity. They are training for scientific-research, designing, organizational and managerial activities in the fields of automation of various spheres of person‚Äôs intellectual activity, in particular, informatization of the operationing of organizations and institutions. At the same time, they can engage in scientific and technical, designing, production and technological activities in the fields of operating and exploitation of computer networks.
Graduates of our department have no problems with employment, because many senior students begin to work at the studying stage. Graduates of the faculty of Informatics and Computer Science of National Technical University of Ukraine ‚ÄúIgor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute‚Äù (along with Faculty of Computer Science and Cybernetics of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv, which is the leading IT faculty of Ukraine) is highly appreciated at labor market.
The graduates of the department ISE work in world-famous companies, among them are
1. Microsoft
2. LUXOFT
3. EPAM
4. Terrasoft Ltd.
5. ‚ÄúNetCracker‚Äù Ltd.
6. LLC ‚ÄúUNITY-BARS‚Äù Ltd.
7. TARGET PLUS Ltd.
8. Company ‚ÄúMiranda‚Äù Ltd.
9. Samsung Electronics Ukraine Company
Types of activity of specialty specialists:
Designing of computer systems
Systems analysis and management
System programming
Data Processing
Maintenance of computer systems
Working with databases
Management
Mathematics for Computer Science
Development of applied software
Designing of computer networks

Admission to the magistracy
If you want to continue study after receiving the Bachelor degree, you can enroll into the National Technical University of Ukraine ‚ÄúIgor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute‚Äù for the 5th year. You will get the next level of higher education ‚Äì master‚Äôs degree level. Study at the 5th year (this level) lasts 1 year 4 months or 1 year 9 months depending on the chosen profile program ‚Äì educational and professional or educational and scientific. Educational and professional profile program is the master‚Äôs training of a certain field of study for the further professional work, educational and scientific profile program is aiming to the magistracy graduate‚Äôs further scientific work.
The programs of entrance professional examinations and additional professional examinations are posted on our site.

metadata.title: Admissions Information on Bachelor level ‚Äì Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering

content:
The Department‚Äôs Specialty Description
Specialty 121 ‚ÄúSoftware Engineering‚Äù
Educational program ‚ÄúINFORMATION SYSTEMS SOFTWARE ENGINEERING‚Äù aims at
training specialists in software development for information systems (IS) for various purposes
using modern design approaches and technologies.
IS are, as a rule, business systems that automate the tasks of organizational management and
business processes in enterprises and organizations of various forms of ownership to increase
their efficiency. Thus, such systems are quite common in the IT industry, whether it is a shop
with its own logistics system, or an audit firm with accounting and reporting systems, or a
vertically integrated holding company that needs planning and control for its many business
processes and management functions.
Any IS is a combined hardware & software platform, in the context of a structured organization.
However, it is the software itself that defines IS as a whole. Many modern ISs are open software
systems, so the task of their integration with related and external systems is relevant now.
Accordingly, graduates of the educational program ‚ÄúInformation Systems Software Engineering‚Äù
work in implementing all stages of the life cycle of IS software: from business analysis of the
work area, through the definition of software system requirements, its modeling and architecture
design to the final software product creation, its quality assurance, release, and support. They
base their work on engineering principles and use methods and tools of software analysis,
design, and building. Without knowledge of the studied methods, it is impossible to competently
create high-quality software.
During their studies, students acquire:
- various technological approaches to software engineering,
- modern business analysis technologies,
- methodologies and tools for IS software designing, developing, and implementing in
different programming languages context (Python, C/C++, C#, Java), - operational systems, modern software platforms and software technology stacks (.NET,
Java, Node.JS).
Modern labor market needs programmers who know how to work in a team and to use the tools
for collaborative software development. That is why the training plan for this educational
program includes disciplines that provide relevant competencies, in particular, ‚ÄúGroup Dynamics
and Communications‚Äù, ‚ÄúIT Project Management‚Äù and others.
ISs are usually designed to process large amounts of information of mixed nature (managerial,
financial, production, analytical) required for management decisions making. Therefore, such
data processing requires the use of modern information technologies, in particular, Big Data
technologies which are based on using a powerful mathematical apparatus: methods of data
mining, simulation, optimization, statistical analysis, machine learning and other methods and
techniques. Thus, the disciplines of the mathematical unit to learn methods and tools of data
processing and analysis take a significant part of the syllabus of this educational program. These
are, in particular, ‚ÄúData Analysis in IS‚Äù, ‚ÄúProbabilistic models and statistical evaluation in IS‚Äù,
‚ÄúMethods of optimization and decision making‚Äù, ‚ÄúProcessing of extra-large data sets‚Äù, ‚ÄúTheory
and methods of machine learning‚Äù and others.
The deep and multifaceted mathematical training is what provides a fairly high level of
competitiveness in the labor market and distinguishes graduates of the educational program
‚ÄúInformation Systems Software Engineering‚Äù among graduates of other educational programs in
the specialty ‚ÄúSoftware Engineering‚Äù.
Although the main activity of a graduate of this educational program is software development, he
still needs to know computer equipment, system infrastructure, etc. Therefore, the training plan
for this educational program also includes the study of computer architecture, computer
networks, Internet of Things (IoT) technologies, Cloud technologies, etc.
During training by the educational program ‚ÄúInformation Systems Software Engineering‚Äù much
attention is paid to the development of practical work skills. This will allow the graduate to
join the work process without additional training. Ensuring a guaranteed level of technological
training of students in accordance with the needs of the IT industry is achieved by conducting a
series of training sessions on the basis of specialized training and practice centers organized at
ISE department.
In particular, the department has the IT technologies training and practice center of EPAM
company. Students receive in-depth training on the main stacks of software development
technologies (Microsoft.NET, Java, Node.JS) in accordance with the training programs of the
training center of this company.
Also, a joint training and practical center with the IT-Enterprise corporation ‚Äî one of the market
leaders in IT solutions for medium and large enterprises ‚Äî works on the basis of the department.
Students can learn there the practical approaches to the implementation of modern ISs and
management decision making technologies using products and cases of this company as the
examples.
Not only classes according to the training plan are held on the basis of these centers, but also
specialized master classes, seminar trainings, guest lectures of successful people working in the
IT area.
Thanks to the integrated multifaceted training, bachelors who have completed this educational
program can work as:
- software developers,
- software architects,
- project managers,
- quality assurance (QA) specialists,
- IS developers in various areas of human activity,
- IS architects,
- ERP programmers,
- ERP consultants,
- systems analysts,
- business analysts (business process specialists),
- data analysts,z
- big data analysts,
- data mining specialists,
- cloud engineers,
- database developers and administrators,
- DevOps engineers, etc.
Areas of their professional activity belong to the industry of creating various information control
systems, custom programming, and software outsourcing.
Benefits of studying at our department
Graduates of the ISE department work in the world-famous companies:

The staff of the department ISE consists of 54 highly qualified lecturers: 4 professors (doctors of sciences), 13 associate professors (candidates of sciences), 6 senior lecturers, 9 assistants (1 candidate of sciences)
In the educational process of the department ISE both the experienced lecturers and the leading scientists of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine are involved. They don‚Äôt only teach courses, but also constantly maintain their professional level by developing large-scale projects for business processes computerization along with postgraduates and students.

metadata.title: Lecturers ‚Äì Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering

content:
History
The department has more than 30 years of practical experience in training.
Department of Automated Production Management Systems (APMS) was established on July 1, 1978 by the order of Ministry of Education of the USSR in May 19, 1978 ‚Ññ 156 (the order of Rector of the Kiev Polytechnic Institute number 80 -‚Äú1‚Ä≥ in June 16, 1978) for system engineers at speciality 2202 ‚Äù Computer-Aided management and data processing systems. Head of the department ‚Äì professor Pavlov O.A.
Since 1987 at the SCB MMS of the V. M. Glushkov Institute of Cybernetics of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine (now it is the Institute of Problems of Mathematical Machines and Systems of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine) branch of the department operates, which has considerable scientific potential and modern computing devices.
According to the rector‚Äôs order ‚Ññ 1-161 from September 19, 1992 APMS department was renamed to the Department of Computer-Aided Management and Data Processing Systems (CAMDPS).
Since 1993-1994 academic year CAMDPS Department training students at ‚ÄúBachelor degree and Specialist degree‚Äù system. Bachelor academic program in 1993-1994 academic year was 6.0804 ‚ÄúComputer Information Technologies‚Äù.
Since 1994-1995 academic year bachelor academic program is 6.0804 ‚ÄúComputer Science‚Äù.
Since 1995-1996 academic year code name and specialty have changed to 7.080401 ‚ÄúComputer-aided information processing and management systems‚Äù. In June 1996 there was the first issue of bachelors according ‚ÄúComputer Science‚Äù academic program.
In April, 1997 by the order of Minister of Education #108 there was established a training and research complex ‚ÄúUzhgorod State Institute of Informatics, Economics and Law ‚Äì National Technical University ‚ÄúKPI‚Äù for common phased training of higher education specialists according academic programs 0804 Computer Science and 0502 ‚ÄúManagement‚Äù.
Complexes provide coordination of joint activities of educational institutions to implement the Law of Ukraine ‚ÄúOn education‚Äù, the introduction of multigraded training system for training and retraining specialists, the joint development of teaching and methodical maintenance.
Since 1997-1998 academic year there is three-graded ‚Äúbachelor ‚Äì specialist ‚Äì master‚Äù system of training specialists. Since 1997-1998 academic year masters training is realized according 8.080401 ‚ÄúComputer-aided Information Processing and Management Systems‚Äù speciality. In June, 1998 there was first issue of masters according 8.080401 ‚ÄúComputer-aided Information Processing and Management Systems‚Äù speciality.
In the 1998-1999 academic year speciality has changed the name to ‚ÄúInformation management systems and technologies‚Äù. That‚Äôs why since 1998-1999 academic year masters training is realized according 8.080401 ‚ÄúInformation management systems and technologies‚Äù speciality.
In April, 1999 there was established a training and research complex ‚ÄúSmilyansky College of Food Industry ‚Äì National Technical University ‚ÄúKPI‚Äù for common phased training of higher educated specialists according academic programs 0804 ‚ÄúComputer Science‚Äù and 0914 ‚ÄúComputer systems, automation and control‚Äù.
Agreement was signed between an educational-scientific complex of the ‚ÄúInformatics and management Center‚Äù of NTUU ‚ÄúKPI, one of subdivisions of which is Informatics and computer engineering faculty, and the V. M. Glushkov Institute of Cybernetics of the NAS of Ukraine about common participation in scientific and educational activities. In December, 2000 by the joint order of the rector of National Technical University of Ukraine ‚ÄúKyiv Polytechnical Institute‚Äù and director of V. M. Glushkov Institute of Cybernetics of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine branch of the ‚ÄúComputer-Aided Information Processing and Management Systems‚Äù department of Informatics and computer engineering faculty of NTUU ‚ÄúKPI‚Äù was established within V. M. Glushkov Institute of Cybernetics. Academician-secretary of Computer Science Division of NAS of Ukraine, V. M. Glushkov Institute of Cybernetics director Sergienko I.V. was appointed as a head of branch of the CAMPDS Department.
Training of specialists according 8.080401 ‚ÄúInformation Management Systems and Technologies‚Äù speciality accredited at level IV (accreditation certificate C–î-–ÜV series # 110,089 from ‚Äú28‚Äù of September, 2001), is realized by license A series # 109,798 from ‚Äú26‚Äù of July, 2001 by categories of educational activities according to Rector‚Äôs order ‚Ññ 1-128 from ‚Äú18‚Äù of September, 2001 about fixing of specialities.
The CAMPDS Department is primary department in Ukraine by 0804 ‚ÄúComputer science‚Äù academic program and 7.080401‚Äù Information Management Systems and Technologies systems‚Äù speciality. For many years head of CAMPDS Department professor Pavlov O.A. is a head of the scientific-methodical committee of the Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine by ‚ÄúComputer Science‚Äù academic program.
Permanent great competition among entrants is evidence of its great popularity.
In the 2008-2009 academic year there were 429 daily studying students (among them 149 students were studying by contract, 17 students were foreign students) and 132 students were studying in tuition by correspondence form (among them 77 students ‚Äì by contract).
More than 2600 specialists were trained by our department during its whole operating term. Citizens from Ukraine, Russia, Vietnam, Bulgaria, Ghana, Guinea, India, Iran, Lebanon, Cameroon, China, Kuwait, Palestine, Peru , Poland, Syria, Tanzania and others as a students studied (or continue to study) at our department.
Many graduates have become general directors and chief engineers of scientific-industrial associations and design institutes, deans of faculties, heads of departments, professors, academicians, doctors and candidates of scince, state awards winners, leading specialists.
18 qualified teachers are working at the department on a regular basis, 12 of whom have doctoral and candidate of scince degrees. 13 qualified teachers are working on the combine jobs basis, the whole of them have doctoral and candidate of science degrees.
At the department postgraduate and doctoral studies operates. For the whole term of department‚Äôs operating 8 doctoral thesises and 60 Ph.D. thesises were defended.
The associate professor, the candidate of the technical science Akinin P.Y, was appointed the head of the department and in 1980 the professor, the doctor of the technical science Pavlov O.A. was elected the head of the department.
Now, act. Head of the Department Ph.D. in Engineering Science, associate professor I.P Muha.

Department
Welcome!
Welcome to the site of the Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering. The basic task of training specialists at our department is to teach them of systemic thinking. Our speciality is integrating for other specializations, therefore it requires wide competence and fundamental training. The leading specialists in the given sphere of knowledge are attracted for reading lectures. The basic task of the department consists in training specialists as analysts of general class. content:
1st International Workshop on Advanced Applied Information Technologies (AdvAIT-2024)
We are glad to invite you to participate in the 1st International Workshop on Advanced Applied Information Technologies (AdvAIT-2024) will be held in Khmelnytskyi, Ukraine and Zilina, Slovakia on November 29, 2024.
The workshop is organized by Information Technologies‚Äô Faculty at Khmelnytskyi National University and Laboratory on Reliability Engineering and Computational Intelligence at University of Zilina with the support of the PUBLIC ORGANIZATION ‚ÄúUKRAINIAN SCIENTIFIC AND EDUCATIONAL IT SOCIETY‚Äù (P–û ‚ÄúUSE IT‚Äù).
Participation and publication are free of charge.
Proceedings of the AdvAIT-2024 shall be submitted to CEUR-WS.org (ISSN 1613-0073) for online publication and planned to be indexed in Scopus & DBLP.
Web-page of Workshop: http://kiis.khmnu.edu.ua/1st-international-workshop-on-advanced-applied-information-technologies-advait-2024/
Workshop topics:
‚Äì Medical information technologies
‚Äì Social information technologies
‚Äì Green information technologies
Authors are invited to submit regular (10-20 pages) or short (5-9 pages) paper in English.
One author (co-author) might submit a maximum of two papers.
Your submission should be prepared using Microsoft Word CEUR-ART Template (see web-page of Workshop).
All papers for participation in the workshop (in DOC format) should be submitted via e-mail: advapplit@gmail.com.
IMPORTANT DATES:
paper submission deadline: October 20, 2024 (the deadline is final, no extension of submission is planned)
notification of acceptance: November 17, 2024
camera-ready submission deadline: November 24, 2024
workshop period: November 29, 2024
